article.headline: N. Colorado 85, Portland St. 72
article.story: GREELEY, Colo. -- Devon Beitzel had 15 points and six assists as Northern Colorado moved into sole possession of first place in the Big Sky Conference by beating Portland State 85-72 on Saturday night. Emmanuel Addo matched a career high with 14 points for the Bears (13-9, 9-2), who led by 27 points in the second half. Tate Unruh added 13 points. Northern Colorado had been tied atop the Big Sky with Montana, but Northern Arizona beat the Grizzlies 70-53 on Saturday. Phillip Thomas led Portland State (11-12, 4-7) with 13 points. Charles Odum and Dane Johnson had 12 points each for the Vikings, who are 1-9 away from home and have lost four of their last five games. Portland State had 15 turnovers, which Northern Colorado turned into 29 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
